intro: Gagea algeriensis var. dutoitii, commonly known as Algerian gagea, is a bulbous perennial plant native to North Africa. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and clusters of small, white or pale pink flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. It is often found in mountainous regions and is valued for its ornamental appeal and resilience. The species is also of interest to botanists due to its unique morphological traits and limited distribution.
